etymologies: early 17th century: from Latin selectio(n-), from seligere ‘select by separating off’ (see select)

definitions: the action or fact of carefully choosing someone or something as being the best or most suitable

examples.text: such men decided the selection of candidates

shortDefinitions: action or fact of carefully choosing person or thing as being best or most suitable

definitions: a number of carefully chosen things

examples.text: the publication of a selection of his poems

definitions: a range of things from which a choice may be made

examples.text: the restaurant offers a wide selection of hot and cold dishes

shortDefinitions: range of things from which choice may be made

definitions: a horse or horses tipped as worth bets in a race or meeting.
shortDefinitions: horse or horses tipped as worth bets in race or meeting

definitions: data highlighted on a computer screen for a particular operation

examples.text: your selection may not contain two different data types

shortDefinitions: data highlighted on computer screen for particular operation

definitions: a process in which environmental or genetic influences determine which types of organism thrive better than others, regarded as a factor in evolution

examples.text: there has been more than enough time for selection to generate specific DNA sequences of the required length

shortDefinitions: process in which environmental or genetic influences determine which types of organism thrive better than others
